newsitem.title: USA: Hewlett unveils cheaper, enhanced printers.
newsitem.headline: Hewlett unveils cheaper, enhanced printers.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co said Monday it had introduced the Enhanced HP Color LaserJet 5/5M printers, priced 31 percent below their predecessors and offering faster photo printing.
The Enhanced Color LaserJet 5 and the Enhanced Color LaserJet 5M are expected to have street prices as low as $3,999 and $5,199, respectively, the company said.
The printers offer the same 1,200-dpi-equivalent image print quality, it said.

"The lower price, combined with HP's already lowest cost of ownership, will make the Enhanced Color LaserJet 5 printers a remarkably inexpensive color laser-printing solution," said George Mulhern, marketing manager of the company's color and consumables division.
